Aleksandra Lazic

            About me
            I am a social psychology PhD Candidate and Research
            Assistant at the University of Belgrade Department of
            Psychology (LIRA
            Lab).
            My PhD project explores how people make vaccination
            decisions in social interactions with others and its
            implications for public communication, using online
            experiments and media content analysis. More broadly, I am
            interested in how people decide to help others and
            contribute to the public good.
            Since 2022, I am part of the research team of the Reason4Health
            project. My main role is to lead and coordinate a
            content analysis study of online media coverage of
            alternative medicine in Serbia.
            I co-founded and maintain LIRA’s open access repository
            of psychological instruments in Serbian (REPOPSI).
            In my spare time, I like to draw, dabble in #SciComm, and
            teach myself R. I created this website with {distill} and
            {postcards}.
            
            
            Research interests
            Vaccination, Public Health Communication, Social Norms,
            Conspiracy Theories & Misinformation, Social Dilemmas,
            Altruism, Intergroup Relations, Open Science
            
            
            Methods
            Experiments (Lab), Online Surveys, Systematic Review
            (with Quantitative Synthesis), Content Analysis,
            Correlational Research, Economic Experiments (Games),
            Psychometric Methods/Scale Development
            
            
            Education
            University of Belgrade | M.A. in Psychology | 2016
            University of Belgrade | Diploma in Psychology | 2015
